alert.note: Alert for Perry (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 8:40PM CDT until June 11 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock AR has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fourche Lafave River Near Houston. * WHEN...From Thursday morning to late Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the Arkansas River and up into the Fourche LaFave begin to flood. Equipment and livestock should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by late tomorrow morning (Thursday June 9) and then rise to a crest of 26.5 feet Friday morning (June 10). - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 7 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Fourche Lafave R Houston 25.0 24.7 Wed 7 PM 25.7 24.7 19.6 26.5 7 AM 6/10 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
